title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep Debt Tracker is a web application built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML to help users visualize and manage their sleep debt. This project allows users to track their sleep patterns, calculate their sleep debt based on personalized sleep goals, and provides insights into improving their sleep habits. It leverages TypeScript for enhanced code maintainability and is designed to be a helpful tool for anyone looking to improve their sleep schedule.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: This repository hosts a project focused on creating interactive map visualizations using HTML for the front-end interface and Python for data processing or backend logic. It explores techniques for displaying geographical data and presenting it in a visually engaging and informative manner on a map.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a Python-based web application built with Flask, PostgreSQL, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, designed as a CRUD project for managing and interacting with data. This repository showcases a practical implementation of creating, reading, updating, and deleting data using a modern web framework and database, serving as a useful example for learning Flask, PostgreSQL integration, and general web development principles in Python. It covers topics like CRUD applications, database interactions, and deploying a basic Python web project.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository hosts a web-based interface built with JavaScript, Python (likely for backend or data processing), HTML, and CSS to visualize and interact with data from the RoboFleet robotics platform. This project focuses on creating a user-friendly dashboard for monitoring robot status, managing tasks, and analyzing performance metrics, falling under the broader topic of robotics project development.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a modern and responsive dashboard interface built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. It serves as a practical example of implementing server-side rendering, dynamic routing, and UI components within a Next.js application, offering a foundation for building complex web applications with enhanced performance and scalability. This repository provides a comprehensive demonstration of project structure, best practices, and common patterns for dashboard development.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven-v2 is a project built using TypeScript and JavaScript, focusing on [insert specific purpose from README if available, e.g., streamlining task management, creating a user-friendly note-taking application, or building a web-based dashboard]. This repository showcases a practical application of modern web development technologies to address [mention the problem it solves, if available from README, e.g., the challenges of disorganized workflows or the need for a centralized information hub]. It explores best practices in project organization and provides a valuable resource for developers interested in [mention the key features, if available from README, e.g., learning about reactive state management, implementing drag-and-drop interfaces, or working with asynchronous data fetching].

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a full-stack web application built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript that allows users to create and participate in various voting systems. This project leverages modern web technologies to provide a seamless and intuitive user experience for managing and engaging in polls and surveys, exploring topics related to project management and web development best practices.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript that serves as a dynamic and collaborative platform for brainstorming and organizing ideas. This project allows users to easily create, manage, and share their thoughts within a visually appealing and user-friendly interface, fostering a more efficient and structured approach to project development and innovation.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting designed to visualize and analyze ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. This project provides a user-friendly interface for filtering, searching, and understanding ROS log data, enabling developers to efficiently debug and improve their robotic applications. This tool helps with ROS project development by offering enhanced log analysis capabilities.

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a full-stack project management application built with Next.js 14, TypeScript, and Material UI (MUI). Leveraging the pages router, React Query for efficient data fetching, and styled with CSS, Devboard provides a streamlined interface for managing tasks, projects, and team workflows. This repository serves as a practical example of modern web development best practices and a demonstration of building robust applications with a focus on developer experience.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the source code for my resume, built using LaTeX for precise formatting and potentially including an HTML version for online accessibility. It serves as a personal project demonstrating skills in document creation and web presentation, focused on showcasing my professional experience and qualifications.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built using Jupyter Notebooks and Python, contains a collection of projects exploring various financial concepts and applications. It serves as a practical learning resource for anyone interested in applying Python to finance, covering topics like stock analysis, portfolio optimization, and potentially other quantitative finance strategies. Visit the repository to explore the individual projects and learn how to implement these concepts yourself.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a full-stack web application leveraging TypeScript, Vite, and Express.js to provide an interface for interacting with the Gemini API. This project explores the capabilities of large language models and showcases a practical application built with modern web development technologies including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, demonstrating API integration and front-end development best practices.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: dynamic-event-calendar is a project showcasing a customizable and interactive event calendar built using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML. This repository provides a foundation for creating a dynamic calendar that can be easily integrated into web applications and tailored to display and manage events effectively.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository hosts a modern IoT asset tracking web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS, leveraging Supabase for database and authentication. It provides a user-friendly interface for monitoring and managing assets in real-time, demonstrating a practical project implementation utilizing key web development technologies.

title: atg-world
description: ATG-World is a personal project showcasing interactive web development skills using TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. This repository explores various web-based functionalities and UI/UX concepts, ultimately serving as a portfolio piece demonstrating practical application of front-end technologies.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a full-stack e-commerce project built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router) and TypeScript, designed for selling fruit. It leverages MUI for the user interface, React Query for efficient data fetching and caching, and TypeScript for type safety throughout the application. This repository showcases a practical implementation of modern web development technologies for building a performant and scalable online store.
